author: Moscadini
title: A new Mini-Rig
review:
According to tyzer12, he states that it is a odd looking ship.  Yes, it does, but tell me...which Mini-Rig in the Star Wars Universe (whether it is a Lego set or a Toy set) is not "oddly looking"?

It is an excellent addition to the Star Wars Universe and to the Empire Army.

Pros -

Small
Has a Shadow Trooper
Practical
Not that expensive in the US

Cons -

It should have come with 4 Storm Troopers rather then only 3 though

author: thepeopleperson
title: I love this set!
review:
This set has excellent value. 4 minifigs for $10.  The stormtroopers are new for 2008, with more detailed and movie-like helmets.  It is also a much better way to get shadowtroopers instead of buying a tie crawler.  Here are some pros and cons

pros-
nice looking ship
great minifigs
2 big blasters and 2 small ones
the troop carrier can be detached
great army builder

cons-
the window falls out sometimes

This set earns itself a definite "yes" from me!

author: Jedd_the_Jedi
title: Rings in the new year Imperial-style!
review: I was estatic to find the new battle packs in stores and quickly snapped both up. I opened this one first, and must say it does not disappoint. The Shadow Trooper looks excellent, and the stormtroopers come with improved helmet designs. Plus, you get the lovely molded guns. My first impression of the dropship was disappointment, but I have to say that once I put it together, it really doesn't look half bad! The dropship is not as flimsy as I expected, and the removeable platform makes for a fine play feature. All in all an excellent way to stock up on troops for your Imperial army.

author: Deinonychus
title: Imperial Assault!
review:
These recent smaller Star Wars sets have all revolved around a central premise; army building. So it was a pleasant surprise to find the new Imperial Dropship is actually a pretty decent vehicle in its own right.

In this set, three standard Stormtroopers make up the crew with a Shadow Stormtrooper acting as the pilot(Cross-training for Shadow Stormies?). The troopers are armed with two of the smaller carbine rifles and two of the longer rifles for hefty firepower. 

A totally LEGO manifested design for the Expanded Universe, the Dropship continues the LEGO TIE Starfighter coloring philosophy of gray, black, and blue. Building is what you'd expect from a set with 81 pieces (many spread out across the Minifigs).Three Imperial Insignia stickers add a little flash, and it's nice to have sticker placement over single bricks instead of over multiple parts that make teaing down and rebuilding difficult.

Once assembled, the Dropship is a joy. As far as LEGOs go, it has a very "Classic Space" vibe and wouldn't look too out of place among the Space Police or Ice Planet guys. It's not straight from the screen, and therefore an abomination to many Star Wars purists, but it's fun and actually acts as a DROP SHIP  because flipping the tail section up releases the rear seating platform and leaves it behind as the craft heads off to pick up another load of Imps. Overall construction is fairly sturdy.

There is a lot to love about this set, but there are also a few low points for me. Personally I'd have preferred an Imperial Pilot flying the thing, but I suppose this is a nice way for LEGO to provide other fans with easy and affordable access to a Shadow Trooper. The look of the ship is a bit clunky and there's really no good place for me to hold it without my hand engulfing the entire ship. Again, while I understand and appreciate the black and blue color-scheme, Imperial war machines should really be gray tones. The price is a little hight for 81 pieces...but I suppose that's mostly due to the Minifig count, which always pushes the cost up. (Still beats the price of individual Stormtroopers on Bricklink)

Overall, a good set. I can't think of a single reason not to buy at least one.

author: jellylikepie
title: nice set
review:
this set is great 

Pros 

black stormtrooper
3 normal stormtroopers
nice blue Colour
2 new small guns 
2 new big guns
opening cockpit 
easy to apply stickers
nice ship
great army builder

cons
small

author: witzenHammer
title: cool. easy to improve for durability
review:
Son loves this.
though he broke it several times right away. so, a few simple additions and it's much better.  We put one of those upward sloping detail bits, I don't know the name, but they're from the classic space theme if I remember right, usually the front of a space ship or small car.  That and a plate across the bottom to firm up the wings and this thing is solid.  That added a little height, so we added another brick under the support for the troop platform.  then substituted a larger plate, and we can fit more troopers easily, as well as have them standing.

cool little set.

author: Mexell
title: New Troopers
review: This one of those great little sets that are fun to build without the instructions. The stormtrooper helmets are modified--larger eye lenses and the stripe across the "nose" is now grey with black vertical lines. The Shadowtrooper is cool with his silver accents. The drop ship function works well, though I added four chairs so the troopers aren't hanging on by the seat of their pants :) I would have liked some kind of controls for the pilot, but that would have gotten in the way of the cockpit hinge. This is a fun set.

author: hustla187
title: great little addition
review: This is a pretty cool set. This is sort of a helicopter but with Stromtroopers. It is a perfect add-on to the Imperial Landing Craft. The Shadow Trooper is a good addition to this set also. I have nothing really bad to say about this set.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: not much to say about this set...
review: Love the new helmets! Awesome! Make your previous stormies out of order, but good! 2 rifles instead of 1 rocks! I think theyshould make the cockpit better, he could fall out and die! I love the wings going up/down and the 3 stormies fall out. bravo again lego, just work on imperial safety!

author: Leggodt94
title: Good little set!
review:
I must say, I am quite fond of this set! Let's see here.....aw yes, first of all, this set is in-expensive(which is always good); it has an adequte supply of minifigures[stormtroopers x3(with new, more detailed gray mouth pieces) and shadow trooper pilot with new gun types]; the ships design[coloration, rooming(cockpit, the place where the troops sit, ect.), and the drop system which is very clever] was good as well. Also, the extra seat on the troop platform is nice, too. 

Yes,.......small and army-building makes for a great set!

author: GreatBear
title: Meh
review: Though the vehicle is interesting, the design is uninspired and doesn't seem to resemble anything from the movies. As far as the figures go, three are the standard stormtroopers and one is an EU "darktrooper". Why not the TIE pilot figure or another stormtrooper? At least they have blasters instead of megaphones. More stormtroopers is great but I have to take off a couple marks for the lame vehicle and oddly unsatisfying "darktrooper". 3/5

author: andy94
title: build your imperial army!
review:
This is one of the best lego sets.with this you can create an imperial army with normal stormtrooper and new shadowtrooper.

Pros
-a lot of minifigs
-nice dropship
-It has a good "drop"function with technic pieces

Cons
-small
-It could have 4 stormtroopers

If you have the rebel scout speeder you can recreate a large battle

author: Rgijaba
title: to my surprise, lego didnt make this up.
review: realy. lego didnt make this up so they could make this set. how do i know this, you ask? well, i looked it up in mt star wars encicapiedia, and right there, on some page, was "imperial dropship".but i dont get why lego put this in the clone wars sub theme... but oh well.this set is nice, and before i got it i thought the pilot was a TIE fighter pilot, but hes a shadow trooper. anyhoo, this set comes with a shadow stromtrooper pilot, and three storm troopers with new grey and blue striped mouths!i also expected this to be weak and flimsy, as it looks in the picure.but it turned out to be very sturdy, i threw it on the coffie table (as part of a joke) and not one piece came off! i also like the drop funcion of the dropship, and the stickers give it more of a hi-tech  feel!so, its a good army builder, the first set with new stor trooper mouths, and lego didnt make it up. id get it if i were you.

author: Gus_263
title: Imperial troopers battle pack
review: This is also a battle pack, featuring the clones as imperial stormtroopers. One of these is a shadow pilot, with black parts. The vehicle is cool, and the name of it is the name of the all set, imperial drop ship. The vehicle can carry four or five minifigures, and if combined, mixed, can be more. It is cool to play and make creations.

author: _add_um
title: Good
review: The high point about this set is the minifigs and the rest well... It includes 3 stormtroopers and a shawdowtrooper, you might have noticed that the stormtroopers helmets are slightly different from the other sets as the mouth piece has more painting detail on it. The dropship or what ever its sposed to be is very badly made but thats because people are going care more about the minifigs. The place where the troopers sit can be detatched which was pretty pointless. There is no controls in cockpit and the window piece keeps faling off. Overall if you have alot of stormtroopers and shadowtroopers i'd pass on this, its nots a bad set but its the ship thats really lets me down LEGO could have have put some detail into the ship.

author: mrmitch
title: Awesome Value -  Great little set !
review: I do not own alot of Star Wars but I couldn't pass up this one. You get 4 (yes four) storm troopers with this set. The way the ship drops the guys is cool. You get four guns, two small and two long guns. This set is only $10.00 and has the most mini figures for the money I've seen. Great addition to any collection and you can easily build an army of storm troopers for a relatively small investment, I am impressed.

author: legoguysw
title: Stupid dropship, but superb figures
review:
Title says it all. If it weren't for the dropship, it would be a five. You get 3 normal Stormies, and one Shadowtrooper. He's basically clone with all his white parts black and black parts silver, but he still looks great. However, the dropship can be modified easily, as there is much space.
There is a drop pad at the back that the normal clones sit on. You pull up a technic lever at the back and it is free to drop.
Great for the figs, but bad price.

author: Noah1997
title: Fun!
review:
so this is a set that you will love if you have the Rebel scout speeder this set is even funner i got both of them i like how you can 
drop the stormtroopers off if you want a good set if you git the set i would git the Rebel scout speeder with it to have more fun other wise you can just use stormtroopers and that is fun too.

review:
This set is godd in almost every way

Pros

author: Matt_Vader
title: New Black Stormtrooper!
review:
Amazing set comes with black pilot stormtrooper
And new guns come with if you like doing battles it's a great addition
Onto the Pros and Cons

author: legostarwarsfan
title: Nice
review:
This is a nice little set but not as good as other ships.

Pros:
3 Stormtroopers
1 Dark Trooper
New blasters
Dropping Function
Engines

Cons:
Window falls off
Stickers
It should have come with some rebels

author: jonbuddy
title: Small and Good
review:
This Dropship is awesome! People complain about the stickers? BIG DEAL! It makes the set better!


Goods:
Shadow Trooper
Sliding rear sitting area thing
Perfect for a full-scale LEGO battle: Rebels vs. The Empire
Stickers

Bads:
Sliding sitting thing comes off easily


Overall:
I may be looking at the bad thing wrong. Maybe it's supposed to do that because if it gets shot off in the battle, it will fall off without a problem. I don't know!

4.7/5
OR
9.8/10

author: Buckbrick
title: Again... this set is all about clones
review:
I have done a review for the Clone trooper battle pack and I will reiterate - I wish Lego will come up with more elaborate vehicles for battle packs. The minifigs are great, but it seems that the vehicles included in these packs are just an after-thought. The drop ship has way more pieces than the speeder pack - at the same price.
In any case, this set along with the Rebel scout speeder are the best among the 4 sets.

The drop ship looks fantastic. I just love blue Lego pieces and they go well with dark gray and black. The shadow trooper is the highlight in this pack of course, while another 3 clones is always a welcome addition. Now we wait for the new clone wars battle pack!

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: Imperial Attack!
review:
I think most Star Wars fans are excited about the release of the 2 all-new battle packs. 

Pros: 

3 stormtroopers with upgraded mouthpieces (gray with black lines)
All-New shadow trooper- this is a nice little detailed figure that works great in anyones imperial army.
2 detailed long blasters and two detailed normal sized blasters- it's nice that they've  given all of the troopers their own blasters
two slots on the top of the dropship- 1 for each of the long blasters, or you can switch it around if you'd like.
the landing platform is a nice new feature, and it works pretty well. every once in a while you have to tip the vehicle to get the platform to come off, but it usually works fine. 
If you have other imperial recruits, there's an extra spot on the platform for them.
the cockpit is nice two because you don't have to pull a piece off to put a mini fig in or take him out. It's more life-like.
The set has wonderful playability so you won't get bored, and it goes hand in hand with the rebel battle pack.
good price
sturdy
small, easy to transport
Cons:
an extra stormtrooper would have been nice, but like i said, you can add other figures to make this set fun.

author: mvila09
title: My new Storm Troopers!
review: I got this set yesterday in the mall and its a good army builder.Heres Pros.Pros 3 storm troopers,one shadow trooper,4 blasters,shadow trooper is very detailed,playiblity.Cons ship doesnt look good without shadow trooper,should include one more storm,Rebel scout speeder is longer.But i just love this set.*****5 stars.

author: ggosling
title: It's the cockpit that let's it down
review:
A great little set and my son's first Star Wars set.

All was going great until the cockpit fell off, was put back on and fell off. The 2x1 fixing simply isn't strong enough to hold the large cockpit.

A shame because the rest of it and especially the slide off rear section is really cool.

4/5

author: legoboy974
title: SWEET
review: this set is so cool! I just got it with the rebel scout speeder.It is a perfect set to build up your army of storm troopers. The shadow trooper is mainly the reason I got this set. I dont know why some people say that the cockpit falls off,my set doesnt do that. I guess some sets come out bad some times.

author: VideoGameLord613
title: Awesome!
review:
18 steps total

Mini figures are cool!

Cons:
Sometimes window can break
Wobbles a lot 

Hey, at least it doesn't break easily
See you around. Bye!

author: spyder38
title: Awesome Set!
review: This is the first set I have ever gotten with storm troopers. And let me tell you it is great! You get A shadow trooper, and three storm troopers with all new guns. The way it drops off the platform is genius. Two thumbs up on this one Lego!

author: Captin_Rex
title: Good cheap little set.
review:
i got two of these things and there great little army builder.This set is a way to get a few storm troopers. Now lets see a few pros and cons, 

Pros

1. Cheap
2. 4 minifigs
3. 3 storm Troopers
4. 4 1 shadow Trooper
5. 8. guns
cons 

1. The platform that holds the storm troopers can fit one more storm trooper.


This set is a great set. When you get this set you should get 2 of them , why , you get 2 ships , 2 shadow troopers , 8 guns , and 6 
storm trooper. this set is a good way to build your empire army.

author: David1971
title: Better than expected
review: This is a neat little set and good value. Before I got it, as with the 7668 Rebel Scout Speeder, I kinda thought it was a set of minifigs with a small extra bit of furniture, and therefore not great value. But the ship is pretty good - small but quite cool, and it has the clever feature of actually dropping off the part that the stormtroopers sit on (like Thunderbird 2! - sort of). Obviously it's quite basic, and if it was an actual ship the poor guys would be at great risk of simply falling off the plate they are meant to sit on. Thankfully, however, they are Lego guys and so stay on just fine. So, a good set.

author: Xwing250
title: Some Nice Features!
review:
I do like this set probably because ive got the rebel scout speeder as well. I was thinking that the the blue pieces should have been gray, making it more like the films. I suppose all of the other Imperial ships had a blue / black colour but it would have been nice for a change. 

Pros:

Stormtroopers
Shadow trooper (nice!)
Drop off function works well
Lots of guns 

Cons:

No controls for pilot

A nice set to get only for battles!

author: Jcc2224
title: Always Get More Than One of the Battle Packs!
review: This Battle Pack is one of the best I've ever seen, I got one for Easter and one over the summer,this is great! Nice pieces, black plates (I love plates) a 'table', glass cocpit, nice blues, and 4 minifigures! Get as many as you can! 10/10!

author: andy87
title: Minifigures are cool but the ship is bad
review: The shadow trooper was my favorite part of this set. He looked so awesome, even better then a darth vader minifigure. The other storm troopers are pretty neat as well, and the guns are very high tech. The ship itself is a pretty bad and shaky design that falls apart easily, i prefer the rebel speeder.

author: shinjix2
title: Stormtroopers!! oh and a ship thingy
review:
Build your Imperial Army and stow away the ship. I may be wrong but the ship seems a little out of place. Don't get me wrong, Its a good ship and I like the fact that it holds weapons and has many movable pieces. I wonder how lego could've implemented a build better with the Sts

Pros:
The "drop" function of the ship
Minifigs including a shadowtrooper

Cons:
Ship is out of place
Back end falls off
Stickers
The back doesn't swing well with troopers on

author: Lint
title: Worth its weight in stormtroopers
review:
This set doesn't look impressive but if you're after stormtroopers its probably the most economical set you will find. The dropship itself is composed of few but great parts, and has more play value than meets the eye.

PROS
-3 stormtroopers & a shadow trooper pilot
-Fun to build
-4 blasters
-Great parts
-Good play value, especially with the dropoff seat mechanism

CONS
-Honestly would have loved 4 stormtroopers instead of three. Theres a seat available out the back for him.
-You get 4 blasters but the two large ones are part of the dropship while the two small ones are held by the troopers. An extra small blaster for the remaining trooper woulda been great.
-The front windshield of the dropship tends to come loose when you open and close it.

Overall, you can't be unhappy with this set... unless you don't like stormtroopers.

author: THX_1138
title: Okay
review:
This set is okay. The vehicle isn't all that good, but the figs are nice.
Pros:
-3 Storm troopers and one rare Shadow Storm trooper in a $10 set.
-The price is reasonable.
-The dropping function on the dropship is pretty cool and work pretty well.
Cons:
-The dropship, aside from the dropping function, is pretty bland.
-Grey would have been better than blue.
-Not a con for me, but some don't like stickers.
-An extra Storm trooper would have been nice.
-The thing the Storm troopers sit on swings around a lot.
-The transparent pieces on the guns (I HATE these)
This is a good army building set, but if you want it for the vehicle alone maybe you should pass.

author: JTR_11
title: Small, neat and great!
review: This set is actually pretty good! Although it is small it is good. I like how you lift up the back to take of the 'seats'. The price is small too which is a good sign. It may look a bit odd at first but when you build it, it doesn't look so bad. You should buy more than one because it's a good army builder.

author: pbj_club
title: good
review:
what can i say this set is good for ten dollars. it is good for army builders abd it looks good with mu collection.i only have one right now but i plan to get at least two more.
pros
four mini figs
cool guns

author: guybrush_threepwood2
title: new stormies......... awesome!
review:
I got this set so I could build an army. the storm troopers are new ones with black dotted lines for mouths instead of normal black ones. these are more realistic than before. 
also as always with expanded universe sets I tray to make sure that it is theoretically possible (in essence, fuel mass, power source, engine type\power, etc.)
this one is NOT POSSIBLE EVEN BY STAR WARS STANDARDS!

so If  you are scientifically obsessed, do not buy this set!
just get it for new stormies!

-guybrush threepwood

author: Wolfshead
title: Good for building an army...
review:
I'm not really sure about the idea behind the vehicle in this set, but I guess they have to add some type of vehicle to justify the price - strange that the back platform has space for four troops, but you only get three (even stranger that the picture above tries to disguise that fact!).

Hey, Lego guys how about selling a pack with say 8 mini-figures and guns etc. for the same price?

Not quite sure how I managed it (mainly due to Woolies going bankrupt) but I have ended up with four of them, which means that my Death Star is nicely populated with Stormtroopers.

author: rexrules
title: "scsh, latching troops, under fire ahhhhhhh BOOM end transmisson
review:
this is an awsome set, it can serve as a troop,vehicle, and wounded transport. it also boosts your army with 3 stormeys and shadow you will love the power

pros: army booster, dropship, shadow trooper

cons: window falls off easily and every one has no face 

other than this is a great set you should get it

author: clone_commander_trainrex
review:
This set is awesome.  Only 10 USD with 4 troopers.  Great battle pack.  Now to the Pros and Cons.
Pros
Ship
Pilot
Top gun storage
stormtroopers
the dropping thingy
Guns are much improved from the megaphone ones
Cons
NONE!

Overall this set is great so for 10 USD get it with the rebel scout speeder

author: legoclone
title: Mini-fig set with some cool possibilities
review: The "dropship" part isn't really the grandest thing but then nobody really expected it to be.  It adds some good pieces to the parts box but as far as being a vehicle is closer in size to a small repulsor skiff than any sort vehicle you’d think would be used for ship-to-surface tactical transport. The true value of this set is for getting stormtroopers and for that it is great for building up your army.  Note – the “pilot” isn’t really a true Imperial pilot although he kind of looks like one on the box.  He’s actually a stormtrooper with black armor which in my book makes him a shadow trooper (aka: elite stormtrooper).   I bought four of these sets so with the four stormtroopers that came with the imperial landing craft and the 12 with these four sets I had a sizable squad of 16 for my modifications to the landing craft (see my review there).  My four “shadow troopers” then were used to compise an elite shadow trooper commando team (and four seems like a reasonable number considering that during the Clone Wars a Republican Commando team was also made up of four elite clone troopers).  I then used the parts from the dropships of these four sets to make them some heavily armed and modified speeder bikes for use by my Shadow team in their elite secret missions in support of the Empire.

author: scbunch
title: Get for the figures
review: I bought this in order to add some storm troopers to my collection.  Worth the price for the figures alone but the drop ship is nice also.  Would recommend for anyone looking to add storm trooper figures to their collection.

author: sger434
title: definatly a great army builder....
review:
reason: because its just great. there may be a few downsides but i'll save them till last. so the best bits about this set are (pros):

4 stormtroopers (3 regular 1 shadow)
worth the money
new design stormtroopers
detachable troop drop pod at the back
great colour scheme
not to overly designed
transparent stickers (many people think this is a con but..)
not just a pill of bricks shoved together (like the old droid battle pack) 

the bad bits (cons)
compartment wobbles in mid air
cockpit is not to detailed 
small weaponary for the ship
boring build
stormtroopers can easily get shot at 
cockpit windshield can fall off easily

final score: 9/10 (5/5) worth getting...

author: wildwill
title: I love this ship
review: I'm not a big multiple-set kind of guy, but I had to have two of these puppies, in fact, I still want more.  Basically you get four figs and a great mini-ship for TEN BUCKS!  Are you kidding me?  Sell the figs separately and keep the pieces if you want, you'll probably come out ahead.

author: ShatteredGnome
title: One More Stormtrooper!
review:
I got this set about a year ago. It's a great way to get stormtroopers, if you can find it. The drop function works well, the stormtroopers have a printed mouth grate, and there's a shdow trooper that looks pretty cool, just a black/silver stormtrooper. The only thing is there's one empty space on the drop platform, but the AT-ST pilot works for a battle Imperial Officer, if ou have one. Overall, a great set!

Probably an 8/10 One more stormtrooper!

author: Alemas
title: Beware the Empire!
review:
This is a great way of getting stormtroopers! It has two blasters, two blaster rifles, three stormtroopers, one shadowtrooper, and a platform for the troops!

Pros:

Stormtroopers
Blasters
Shadowtroopers(rare)
Platform for troops

Cons:

The window keeps detaching
The platform swings too much, hitting the troopers' helmets

Overall, a great set!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Imperial Dropship
review:
The Imperial Dropship set (7667) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2008. It comes with 4 minifigs and 81 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7667-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

Stormtroopers (3x): The stormtroopers are very basic. They have a double-printed armor and a black head under their helmet. The helmet has a few markings.

Imperial pilot (1x): Same as the stormtroopers. The only difference is that that guy has a black armor and a black helmet with gray markings.

Imperial Dropship:

The dropship is very easy to build. The cockpit opens and you can put in the pilot. On each side you can see a laser. On the top there's also a blaster on each side. If you want to drop the platform where the 3 stormtroopers sit you have to lift the back with the engines up. Then you can see a LEGO Technic piece which is holding the platform and you can take it away.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Great army builder
Price

Negative:

Not so many play features
Too easy to build
Stickers
No controls for the pilot

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Cona_Chris
title: Nice army builder, but...
review:
This set is a nice army builder (I mean who couldn't use more Stormtroopers and the exclusive Shadow Trooper?), but I was a little dissappointed with the actual dropship once it was built.  Building was easy and the feature of just dropping off the stormtroopers is pretty cool, however.

Pros:
+Price
+4 Mini-Figs including the Shadow Trooper

Cons:
+Hard to put weapons in the holder holes on top
+Cockpit always comes off
+Part the the Stormtroopers sit on always come undone
+The dropshop often breaks apart in the middle when "flying"

I ended up with a lot of cons compared to pros, but it's not like the dropship is terrible or anything.  I still think it was worth it for the mini-figs, but just wish the dropship was a little more durable when put together.

author: Lego_Minifig_Man
title: "Only imperial stormtroopers are so precise"
review:
This is a great set! If only I'd bought a few more while they were available! I was hoping to build a Imperial Army, but I decided that after this set  stopped being made. Boo-Hoo.

 I like this set a lot. It has some blue colors, which would look sooo much better in grey! (Have you compaired the old TIE fighter with the new TIE fighter yet??) The back part with the, uh, thruster-things, goes up so you can slide the platform off with the stormtroopers on it. The cockpit window moves so you can put in and take out the pilot. The stormtroopers have new helmets, which look really cool and movie-accurate! Anyways, on to the pros and cons!

Pros:
Stormtroopers
Shadowtrooper
The stormtroopers chest-pieces have print/pictures on both sides.
Rare cockpit window piece
Four blasters, two small, two large
Imperial logo stickers (I have no idea why everyone hates stickers! None of mine have fallen off!)

Cons:
Cockpit window part falls off easily when opening and closing it.
The platform the Stormtroopers sit on is really wobbly
There is a emty space on the platform, which is the ideal place for a fourth stormtrooper
The stormtroopers faces are black
There's this thing on the top of the cockpit piece thats like a hook or somthing a minifig can hold onto, but it's completely pointless.

Conclusion:
Buy like fifteen-THOUSAND of these things. The dropship could use a little improvment, but the Stormtroopers are worth it. You can also buy some of those clone wars clone battle packs and use their heads to rplace these stormtroopers black ones. You'll have your army in no time!

author: Darthleapyous
title: meza likey!
review:
I like this set very much, i recomend it to all people.It has a nice colour and a shadow stormtrooper!


pros:
shadow stormtrooper
3 new version stormtroopers
nice colour scheme

cons:

stickers


overall:

this is a 4 for me.

hmmm this is my first review..

pros

Cons:

overall: not bad, but not great either. This is the cheapest way to make a Stormtroper army ! so, what do you waiting for? go get this set !

author: james3426
title: "That deploy platform sometimes accidently falls off, stormtropers"
review:
I got this set because I wanted to stage a battle with the rebel scout speeder. The stormtroopers did not disappoint me, but that deploy platform is so annoying! It breaks off even if you do not release it! The rest is good, like the place they put the rifles. Now I no how to make a good gun storage. I really like that rare shadow trooper.

pros:
Cool design
Shadowtrooper
Stormtroopers
Imperial insignias
Rifles

cons:
That annoying depoy platform!

I do not tell you to get this set, but if you want the pieces, like the shadowtrooper, feel free.

author: shieldsy
title: what if the troopers fall out?
review:
Welcome to my review of imperial dropship.Now lets get started.This set come's with three regular stormtroopers and one shadow trooper.Their are three stickers in this set.While building this set I nearly fell asleep the build was that bad.At the back of the ship their is a droping pad.This pad is a nightmare because when you swoosh the ship around it falls off.The cockpit on the set dosen't cover the driver fully and their is no controls for him to steer.

pros:

four clones

cons:

cockpits not fully covered

boring build

pad at the back falls off easily

not even a lever for the driver to use

overall 2/5

               -shieldsy

author: familyguy101
title: happy when I got it
review:
This is a pretty nice set. I remember when i first got it. I really recommend it alot. Its a really good impierial navy builder(cause thats what its ment for). I think you can still get it in stores. Now onto the pros and cons

PROS

      4 minifigs: stormtrooper (3), tie pilot

      contains dropship

      opening cockpit

      lift up the engines to deploy the platform full of stormtroopers

      platform full of storm troopers rotates with the ship as you twist it side to side

     

 

CONS

      could have came with more stormtroopers

 

Well thats pretty much it. I think you can still get this in stores. I really recommend this for your impierial navy. Read my other reviews!

author: Huge_Nerd
title: Stormtroopers!
review:
pros

  • Stormtroopers!
  • interesting vehicle with a fun function
  • decent build for the size
  • good price

cons

  • windshield may come off when you open it
  • a pilot rather than a Shadowtrooper would have been better, but he's cool too
  • one more gun would make it perfect

author: Johan_V_D_
title: Reinforcements
review:
This set is what it is.. a dropship... ready to drop some extra stormtroopers into your army or collection.

Dont expect to much from the ship itself. It a simple build, with a nice feature though, and if you are just a starwars movie / original trilogy fan, you will never have seen it before.
So the ship itself isnt a real must in a collection.

However, it brings 3 stormtroopers and a shadow trooper into battle. An for its price when it was available in stores, this realy was an interesting option for expanding your imperial army.
(contrary to ep2 / CW clone troopers, storm troopers havent been that widely available).

Is it all and only about the troopers then?.. No, the ship has some playability too, specialy with its "drop" function, but then mainly in fantasy play. Its not for reenacting any SW scene.

So, do I recommend this set?... If it were still in the stores, I would say: grab all you can, or at least, till you have the amount of stormies you need. (pitty I didnt, thinking it would last for longer..)
But at the actual prices it goes today on ebay, its maybe better to buy lose troopers, if that is what you are looking for. The surplus you pay for the complete set/ship, isnt justified by the pieces.

  • *minifigs : 5/5
  • *playability : 4/5
  • *build & pieces : 2/5

author: Odeinoichus
title: Look Sir, Droids
review:
Set #7667 Imperial Dropship: As hinted at by the picture on the box this set looks like it's meant to represent troop movement on Tatooine. And the vehicle could probably work as something of an addition to any Tatooine displays. Or Imperial Displays even.

 

The Imperial Dropship is built with a combination of blue and black pieces with some grey thrown in for good measure. Stickers are used to deck out the airspeeder (I'd have to say it's more of an Airspeeder or part of a larger vessel since I doubt it would work outside of a planet's atmosphere.) with Imperial Emblems.

 

Three Stormtroopers and one Shadow Trooper are included with the set, I don't know why they decided to call him a Shadow Trooper as opposed to an Imperial Pilot, although I suspect it's because they used the Stormtrooper armor/helmet for him in black as opposed to the Imperial Pilot. Four blasters are included as accessories, two long and two short. Overall I'd have to say that as far as Battle Packs go it's a nice addition and good for troop building Imperials, but the vehicle is a tad on the odd side of things. But Star Wars is full of strange looking vehicle designs. I'd recommend you to get two or more of this set if you can, and as far as displaying it with larger vessels, the Imperial Landing Craft would make an excellent companion to this little vehicle.

author: Zach99
title: Army Builder
review:
Great Army Builder

Pros

  • Cheap
  • Great playability
  • 3 stormtroopers and a shadow trooper

Cons

  • Doesn't have great pieces

author: Chills
title: Cool set, good army builder
review:
After I had picked up most of the retired sets on my wanted list I still had this one sitting there. I decided to actively go for it and during my most recent trip to Spain I won an ebay auction getting this set for a pretty good price. For $9.99 RRP this is a really cool set. Its main function is definitely an army builder, but the drop ship is a pretty neat part of the set.

Pros

  • Pro 1: The dropship has a great Imperial feel to it. I have this sitting next to the Imperial Landing Craft 7659 and they compliment each other well. This set has cool playability, its swooshable and has a deployable platform to land stormtroopers in the heat of battle. Nicely done for an inexpensive set.
  • Pro 2: The minifigures are definitely a pro. 3 stormtroopers and a shadow trooper (basically a black painted stormtrooper). The later only appears in this set and the TIE Crawler. So you have an army builder and a rare minifigure for your collection.

Cons

  • Con 1: Its hard to think of a con with this set, its well done for a good price. I guess if I had to be picky I'd say there could be a couple of clips on the side for the stormtrooper rifles (they sit on the top in open hole studs). But that is a very minor point.

This really is a cool set, and a good army builder. I paid over RRP for a used one, which is normal for these types of sets, but I am definitely happy with my purchase. If you're building up your stormtrooper army and want a unique minifigure to add to your collection you'd better pick this set up.

author: Blockland
title: A very underrated BP
review:
I remember back 2008, I was in the 5th grade, and just found out about Brickset, though I never got an account till 2012. The second I saw the new battle packs, I was intrigued by these sets, though most of my attention was caught by the Rebel Alliance Trooper battle pack. Still, I picked up this set and was very impressed.

Box/Instructions

The box is somewhat small, has the same Darth Vader banner at the top since 2005. The instructions had no mistakes, and were clear to read. The box, however, has a slight error, and uses the full black lined mouth helmets.

 

Parts

The parts in this set were mostly ramps and plates, though it did come with some technic pieces in the bunch. The parts could easily be used in a larger model is one desired.

 

Minifigures

The Minifigures are what make a battle pack, and while this set didn't provide any new Minifigures, it had a very nice ratio of storm troopers. We get 3 regular, white storm troopers, 1 with a blaster pistol, and 2 with a blaster rifle. We also get a superb shadow trooper, and while it makes more since to have a pilot, the shadow trooper fits in nice.

 

The build

It is a very fun 5 minute build. There is very limited use of the SNOT technique, and is mostly made out of ramps and a cockpit piece.

 

The completed model

The completed model is great, and very reminiscent of a LAAT. The wings move up and sideways, and a little carrier piece is attachable for the storm troopers. It is somewhat nice to see Lego make their own vehicle.

 

Overall opinion

A nice set for only 10$, and really makes me wish Lego would stop trying to force battle packs to be 13$. The completed model is nice, the Minifigures are great, and is an overall good set. If you can find this set for under 25$, it is worth a buy.

author: Max_Rebo
title: My first LSW Set
review:
When I see this set on my desk,I have a nostalgia feeling,because this was the first LSW Set,which I got.I was only six years old.

Pros:

---->also a great army builder

Playability(the playability is even better in combination with the rebel trooper BP)

Guns(it is good,that there are two of both guns in this set)

Easy build(this is a pro for Kids)

 

 

Cons:

There's no controls for the pilot

I'm missing a shooting function 

Overall opinion:

In my opinion it's a good set for that price and if you can get it cheap today,buy it,you can't get enough stormies;-)

 

Thank you for Reading my first review
